ArticleInfo.ArticleTitle: Association of Uric Acid with Stenosis of Intracranial and Extracranial Arteries in Elderly Patients with Cerebral Infarction

Affiliation.OrgName: Institute:the neurology department of The Second Affiliated Hospital of Fujian Medical University

RawAuthorGroup.Para: INSTITUTE:THE NEUROLOGY DEPARTMENT OF THE SECOND AFFILIATED HOSPITAL OF FUJIAN MEDICAL UNIVERSITY
INSTITUTE:THE NEUROLOGY DEPARTMENT OF THE HOSPITAL OF JINJIANG CITY
INSTITUTE:THE NEUROLOGY DEPARTMENT OF THE SECOND AFFILIATED HOSPITAL OF FUJIAN MEDICAL UNIVERSITY
INSTITUTE:THE NEUROLOGY DEPARTMENT OF THE SECOND AFFILIATED HOSPITAL OF FUJIAN MEDICAL UNIVERSITY
ADDRESS:ZHONGSHAN NORTH ROAD 34, QUANZHOU CITY ,FUJIAN PROVINCE 362000,P.R.CHINA

Para.Emphasis: Association of Uric Acid with Stenosis of Intracranial and Extracranial Arteries in Elderly Patients with Cerebral Infarction

Article.Para: Background: TO DETERMINE THE CORRELATION OF URIC ACID༈UA༉WITH INTRACRANIAL AND EXTRACRANIAL ATHEROSCLEROSIS STENOSIS OF HAN POPULATION ELDERLY PATIENTS SUFFERING FROM CEREBRAL INFARCTION IN THE CITY OF QUANZHOU IN FUJIAN.

Methods: FOR THIS STUDY, WE ENROLLED ELDERLY PATIENTS WITH CEREBRAL INFARCTION BETWEEN OCTOBER 2015 AND DECEMBER 2017 AT THE NEUROLOGY DEPARTMENT OF THE SECOND AFFILIATED HOSPITAL OF FUJIAN MEDICAL UNIVERSITY. ALL PATIENTS WERE EXAMINED BY COMPUTED TOMOGRAPHY ANGIOGRAPHY (CTA). PAST MEDICAL HISTORY, DEMOGRAPHIC DATA, AND BIOCHEMICAL MARKERS WERE COLLECTED. MULTIPLE LOGISTIC REGRESSION ANALYSIS WAS USED TO STUDY THE ASSOCIATION BETWEEN URIC ACID AND CEREBRAL ATHEROSCLEROSIS STENOSIS.

ItemContent.Para: Results: A TOTAL OF 408 PATIENTS WERE ENROLLED IN THE STUDY AND DIVIDED INTO THE ELDER GROUP(N = 196)AND THE YOUNG AND MIDDLE-AGED GROUP(N = 212). IN OLD STROKE PATIENTS,72CASES (36.73%) WERE CLASSIFIED AS THE INTRACRANIAL ATHEROSCLEROSIS STENOSIS (ICAS) GROUP, 45CASES (22.96%) AS THE COMBINED INTRACRANIAL AND EXTRACRANIAL ATHEROSCLEROSIS STENOSIS (COAS) GROUP, 21CASES (10.71%) AS THE EXTRACRANIAL ATHEROSCLEROSIS STENOSIS (ECAS) GROUP, AND 58CASES (29.59%) AS THE NON-CEREBRAL ATHEROSCLEROSIS STENOSIS (NCAS) GROUP. COMPARED WITH THE NCAS GROUP, URIC ACID WAS SIGNIFICANTLY HIGHER (P = 0.033)IN THE ICAS GROUP,COMPARED WITH THE GROUP WHICH HAD ONLY ONE STENOSIS ARTERY, URIC ACID WAS HIGHER IN THE ADVANCED STENOSIS GROUP (P < 0.001),THE MULTIPLE LOGISTIC REGRESSION ANALYSES SHOWED THAT URIC ACID WAS AN INDEPENDENT RISK FACTOR FOR INTRACRANIAL STENOSIS OF ELDERLY PATIENTS༈OR = 1.003,P = 0,042),BUT THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN EXTRACRANIAL ARTERY STENOSIS AND URIC ACID WAS NEGATIVE.

Article.Para: Conclusions: THE ELEVATED URIC ACID LEVEL CORRELATES WITH INTRACRANIAL ARTERY STENOSIS AND IT IS AN UNDERLYING INDEPENDENT RISK FACTOR OF INTRACRANIAL ARTERY STENOSIS IN ELDERLY PATIENTS WITH CEREBRAL INFARCTION .

ItemContent.Para: WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOCIETY, ISCHEMIC STROKE IS ONE OF THE MOST COMMON CAUSE OF DEATH AND A LEADING CAUSE OF DISABILITY AMONG OLD PEOPLE,STENOSIS OF INTRACRANIAL AND EXTRACRANIAL ARTERIES IS NOT ONLY THE PATHOLOGICAL FOUNDATION OF CEREBRAL INFARCTION, BUT ALSO THE COMMON REASON[1] [2].THE CORRELATION BETWEEN URIC ACID (UA)AND CARDIOVASCULAR DISEASE IS STILL DISPUTED[3][4]. FEW STUDIES EXIST THAT HAVE INVESTIGATED THE CORRELATION BETWEEN URIC ACID AND STENOSIS OF INTRACRANIAL AND EXTRACRANIAL ARTERIES. THIS STUDY WAS PERFORMED TO EVALUATE THE FREQUENCY OF STENO-OCCLUSIVE INTRACRANIAL AND EXTRACRANIAL ARTERIES IN ISCHEMIC STROKE ELDERLY PATIENTS AND COMPARE THE SERUM LEVELS OF URIC ACID WITH ISCHEMIC STROKE WITH ICAS, ECAS, AND NCAS AMONG ELDERLY PATIENTS .

WE RETROSPECTIVELY RECRUITED CONSECUTIVE PATIENTS WITH ACUTE ISCHEMIC STROKE WHO UNDERWENT CT ANGIOGRAPHY WITH RELEVANT NEUROIMAGING FINDINGS FROM OCTOBER 2015 THROUGH DECEMBER 2017 AT THE NEUROLOGY DEPARTMENT OF THE SECOND AFFILIATED HOSPITAL OF FUJIAN MEDICAL UNIVERSITY. PATIENTS WERE CLASSIFIED INTO FOUR GROUPS BASED ON THEIR VASCULAR IMAGING AS FOLLOWS: 1) INTRACRANIAL STENOSIS ATHEROSCLEROSIS (ICAS) GROUP, 2) COMBINED INTRACRANIAL AND EXTRACRANIAL ATHEROSCLEROSIS STENOSIS (COAS) GROUP, 3) EXTRACRANIAL CAROTID STENOSIS ATHEROSCLEROSIS (ECAS) GROUP, 4) NON-CEREBRAL STENOSIS ATHEROSCLEROSIS (NCAS) GROUP. THE ELDER GROUP INCLUDED PATIENTS OLDER THAN 60 YEARS,THE YOUNG AND MIDDLE-AGED GROUP INCLUDED PATIENTS YOUNGER THAN 60 YEARS. WE COLLECTED DATA ON CLINICAL INFORMATION, DEMOGRAPHICS, AND BIOCHEMICAL INDICES.

SUBJECT INCLUSION CRITERIA: ༈1༉PATIENTS WITH CEREBRAL INFARCTION WHO WERE MATCHED WITH THE 2010 GUIDELINES FOR THE CHINESE DIAGNOSIS AND TREATMENT OF ACUTE ISCHEMIC STROKE[5].༈2༉AGE > 18; (3) EXAMINED BY CTA.

SUBJECT EXCLUSION CRITERIA: (1) AGE ≤ L8; (2) NEUROIMAGING AND LABORATORY INFORMATION WAS INCOMPLETE (3)HAD DRUGS AFFECTING URIC ACID METABOLISM USE IN 3 MONTHS.(FOR EXAMPLE, DIURETICS, ANTI-GOUT DRUG) (4) STROKE OF OTHER DETERMINED ETIOLOGIES (RHEUMATIC HEART DISEASE, ATRIAL FIBRILLATION, ACUTE CORONARY SYNDROME, PATENT FORAMEN OVALE, SUBACUTE ARTERIAL ENDOCARDITIS, MOYAMOYA DISEASE, ARTERIOVENOUS MALFORMATION, SYPHILITICA VASCULITIS, IMMUNE VASCULITIS, ARTERY DISSECTION, RADIATION STENOSIS, BLOOD DISEASE, SUBSTANCE ABUSE AND SO ON).

DEFINITION OF RISK FACTORS: (1) HYPERTENSION: HYPERTENSION WAS DEFINED AS SYSTOLIC BLOOD PRESSURE ≥ 140 MMHG AND/OR DIASTOLIC BLOOD PRESSURE ≥ 90 MMHG DURING THE 7 DAYS AFTER STROKE ON DIFFERENT DAYS MORE THAN 3 TIMES OR A HISTORY OF PHYSICIAN DIAGNOSIS OF HYPERTENSION. (2) DIABETES MELLITUS: THE PATIENTS FIT ONE OF THE FOLLOWERING: 1) SYMPTOM OF DIABETES MELLITUS AND RANDOM PLASMA GLUCOSE ≥ 11.1 MMOL/L; 2) SYMPTOMS OF DIABETES MELLITUS AND FASTING BLOOD GLUCOSE ≥ 7.0 MMOL/L; 3) SYMPTOM OF DIABETES MELLITUS AND BLOOD GLUCOSE OF THE 2 HOUR OGTT ≥ 11.1 MMOL/L; OR A HISTORY OF DIABETES MELLITUS; (3) SMOKING: PATIENTS HAD MORE THAN FIVE CIGARETTES FOR MORE THAN TWELVE MONTHS AND DID NOT GIVE UP SMOKING OR HAVE GIVEN UP SMOKING FOR LESS THAN 6 MONTHS.

THE STUDY WAS APPROVED BY THE ETHICS COMMITTEES OF:SECOND AFFILIATED HOSPITAL OF FUJIAN MEDICAL UNIVERSITY,QUANZHOU, FUJIAN PROVINCE, CHINA. PATIENTS OR THEIR FAMILYMEMBERS PROVIDED WRITTEN INFORMED CONSENT.

Para.Emphasis: Definition on Stenosis of Intracranial and Extracranial Arteries

ItemContent.Para: THE EXTRACRANIAL ARTERIES INCLUDED THE CAROTID ARTERY (CCA), EXTERNAL CAROTID ARTERY (ECA), THE EXTRACRANIAL PORTION OF INTERNAL CAROTID ARTERY (E-ICA) (C1), THE EXTRACRANIAL PORTION OF VERTEBRAL ARTERY (V1-V3), AND THE SUBCLAVIAN ARTERY (SCA). THE INTRACRANIAL ARTERIES INCLUDED THE INTRACRANIAL PORTION OF THE CAROTID ARTERY (I-ICA) (C4-C7), MIDDLE CEREBRAL ARTERY (MCA), ANTERIOR CEREBRAL ARTERY (ACA), POSTERIOR CEREBRAL ARTERY (PCA), INTRACRANIAL PORTION OF VERTEBRAL ARTERY (I-VA) (V4), AND BASILAR ARTERY (BA).

BLOOD SAMPLES FOR FASTING CONCENTRATIONS WERE DRAWN IN THE MORNING WITHIN 24 HOURS; SERUM LEVELS OF TOTAL CHOLESTEROL(TC), TRIGLYCERIDE(TG), HIGH-DENSITY LIPOPROTEIN CHOLESTEROL(HDL-C),UA ,LOW-DENSITY LIPOPROTEIN CHOLESTEROL(LDL-C) FIBRINOGEN(FIB),HEMOGLOBIN A1C(HBALC)AND HOMOCYSTEINE(HCY) WERE ANALYSED USING A BECKMAN AU680 CHEMISTRY SYSTEM AND A BECKMAN LH 780 HAEMATOLOGY ANALYSER ACCORDING TO THE MANUFACTURER’S INSTRUCTIONS (BECKMAN COULTER, BREA, CA, USA).
COMPUTED TOMOGRAPHY ANGIOGRAPHY (CTA)

CTA WAS DONE USING A 64-SLICE DOUBLE SOURCE CT FROM SIEMENS AG EXCEPT HEMORRHAGIC CEREBROVASCULAR DISEASE. AFTER CONVENTIONAL CROSS-SECTIONAL SCANNING, WE FINISHED THE HEAD AND NECK SCANNING WITH BOLUS INJECTION OF IOPAMIDOL (300MGI/ML) BY HIGH PRESSURE INJECTOR THROUGH THE RADIAL VEIN AT THE RATE OF 4–5 ML/S. THE SCANNING RANGE: 7TH CERVICAL VERTEBRAE TO BASIS CRANII. REAL-TIME MONITORING AFTER INJECTION, WE SCANNED AT THE PEAK VALUE OF CONTRAST MEDIUM. WE INVESTIGATED STENOSIS OF INTRACRANIAL AND EXTRACRANIAL ARTERIES THROUGH THE IMAGE RECONSTRUCTED BY MAXIMUM INTENSITY PROJECTION AND VOLUME RENDERING.THE WAY OF RECONSTRUCTION: SURFACE-SHADED DISPLAY, VOLUME RENDERING, SURFACE RECONSTRUCTION.ALL IMAGES WERE READ BY TWO NEUROIMAGING EXPERTS.

FOR STATISTICAL ANALYSIS, SOFTWARE VERSION SPSS20.0 WAS USED (SPSS INC., USA). DATA WERE SUMMARIZED AS MEAN ± SD OR SE OR NUMBER OF SUBJECTS (PERCENTAGE), AS APPROPRIATE. COMPARISONS ACROSS GROUPS WERE EXAMINED USING THE CHI-SQUARE TEST FOR CATEGORICAL VARIABLES AND STUDENT’S T-TEST OR ONE-WAY ANALYSIS OF VARIANCE FOLLOWED BY THE TURKEY’S B TEST FOR MULTIPLE COMPARISONS FOR CONTINUOUS VARIABLES. A MULTIVARIABLE LOGISTIC REGRESSION ANALYSIS WAS PERFORMED TO FIND THE INDEPENDENT PREDICTOR OF ICAS OR ECAS. RESULTS WERE GIVEN BY ORS AND THEIR 95% CIS. P < 0.05 WAS CONSIDERED STATISTICALLY SIGNIFICANT. ALL TESTS WERE TWO-TAILED.

Section1.Heading: RESULTS
Section1.Para: 196 elderly patients were included in this study,212young and middle-aged patients at the same time, altogether 408 patients. The old stroke patients had a mean ± SD age of 72.73 ± 5.37 years,(range 65–89 years) and 120 were male.

Para.Emphasis: Distribution of Stenosis of Intracranial and Extracranial Arteries

Section1.Para: In old patients,72(36.73%) were classified as ICAS, 45 (22.96%) as COAS, 21 (10.71%) as ECAS, and 58 (29.59%) as NCAS.In young and middle-aged patients,64(30.19%) were classified as ICAS, 28 (13.21%) as COAS, 24 (11.32%) as ECAS, and 96(45.58%) as NCAS. Compared with young and middle-aged patients,cerebral artery stenoses often happen in old people,especially intracranial artery stenoses,(Fig. 1).

The proportion of old patients with different numbers of stenoses of intracranial arteries was as follows: 53(27.04%) of one artery, 35 (17.18%) of two arteries, 29 (14.80%) of three or more arteries.
The proportion of old patients with different numbers of stenoses of extracranial arteries was as follows: 41 (20.92%) of one artery, 15 (7.65%) of two arteries, 9 (4.59%) of three or more arteries.

CaptionContent.SimplePara: Distribution of stenoses of intracranial and extracranial arteries in different age

ItemContent.Para: IN OLD PATIENTS,COMPARED WITH NCAS, ICAS GROUP SHOWED SIGNIFICANTLY HIGHER FREQUENCIES OF MALE༈P = 0.033,X2 = 4.76༉.ICAS, ECAS, AND COAS GROUPS SHOWED SIGNIFICANTLY HIGHER LEVELS OF LDL-C(P = 0.048,P = 0.015 AND 0.002,RESPECTIVELY),TC WAS SIGNIFICANTLY HIGHER IN THE ICAS GROUP AND COAS GROUP (P = 0.02 AND P = 0.08, RESPECTIVELY),UA WAS SIGNIFICANTLY HIGHER IN THE ICAS GROUP AND COAS GROUP (P = 0.033 AND P = 0.018, RESPECTIVELY)., BUT OTHER CHARACTERISTICS WERE NOT SIGNIFICANTLY DIFFERENT ,(Table 1).
*p < 0.05vsNCAS

DIVIDED UA INTO QUARTERS༈1ST ≤ 261.2 ΜMOL/L༛261.2 ΜMOL/L༜2ND ≤ 321.9 ΜMOL/L༛321.9 ΜMOL/L༜3RD ≤ 388.8 ΜMOL/L༛4TH༞388.8 ΜMOL/L༉.WHERE THE HIGHER THE LEVEL OF UA, THE HIGHER THE PERCENTAGE OF CEREBRAL ATHEROSCLEROSIS STENOSIS(X2 = 9.231,P = 0.024༉,(FIG. 2).

CaptionContent.SimplePara: Distribution of the study group according to apo A1 and apo B

ItemContent.Para: COMPARED WITH THE GROUP WHICH HAD ONLY ONE STENOSIS ARTERY, UA WAS HIGHER IN THE ADVANCED STENOSIS GROUP (P༜0.001) (FIG. 3). THE LEVEL OF UA HAD NO STATISTICAL DIFFERENCES IN DIFFERENT NUMBERS OF ECAS(FIG. 4).

Section1.Para: Figure3. Serum levels of UA according to severity of ICAS Fig. 4. Serum levels of UA according to severity of ECAS

ItemContent.Para: WE SELECTED AGE, TC, LDL-C, UA, DIABETES MELLITUS,GENDER,HYPERTENSION, INTO MULTIVARIABLE LOGISTIC ANALYSIS. WE FOUND THAT UA WAS AN INDEPENDENT RISK FACTOR OF INTRACRANIAL STENOSIS (OR: 0.003, 95% CI: 1.000–1.007),(TABLE 2).BUT UA WAS NOT AN INDEPENDENT RISK FACTOR OF EXTRACRANIAL STENOSIS,(TABLE 3).

Section1.Para: Table 2. Multivariate logistic regression analyses for independent clinical and demo-

Section1.Para: Table 3. Multivariate logistic regression analyses for independent clinical and demo-

ItemContent.Para: STENOSIS OF INTRACRANIAL AND EXTRACRANIAL ARTERIES IS NOT ONLY THE IMPORTANT PATHOPHYSIOLOGICAL BASIS OF STROKE BUT THE MOST COMMON ETIOLOGY OF STROKE[1] [2].IN OUR STUDY, CEREBRAL ARTERY STENOSES MORE OFTEN HAPPENED IN OLD PEOPLE,ESPECIALLY INTRACRANIAL ARTERY STENOSES. THAT MAY EXPLAIN WHY MORE AND MORE PEOPLE SUFFER FROM STROKE WITH AGE.

URIC ACID IS THE METABOLIC END PRODUCT OF ENDOGENOUS AND EXOGENOUS PURINE METABOLISM, WHICH ARE THE MAJOR COMPONENTS OF RNA AND DNA[6]. ACCORDING A SURVEY UNDERTAKEN IN CHINA,10% OF THE TOTAL POPULATION HAS HYPERURICAEMIA, WHICH ACCOUNTS FOR AROUND 120 MILLION PEOPLE[7].The correlation between UA and cardiovascular disease is still disputed.It was once thought that UA was an antioxidative substance which could prevent arteriosclerosis[3].But recently large prospective studies have demonstrated that hyperuricaemia was an independent risk factor of cerebral-cardiovascular diseases. Some American scholars found that UA was an independent risk factor of myocardial infarction and stroke[8].Sciacqua insisted that was an independent predictor of cardiovascular events in post-menopausal women[4].Some experts argued that hyperuricemia rose the risk of death and possibly increased the chance of relapse in stroke patients[9][10].Few studies have reported on the relation-ship between uric acid and intracranial and extracranial atherosclerosis stenosis. In this present study, hyperuricaemia was a risk factor for intracranial atherosclerosis stenosis in both the univariate and multivariate logistic regression analyses. The level of UA was higher in people who had more lesions of intracranial atherosclerosis stenosis.

Section1.Tablefootnote: THE PATHOGENESIS OF HYPERURICAEMIA-PROMOTING ARTERIOSCLEROSIS APPEARS TO BE CONSISTENT WITH STROKE: (I) URIC ACID PROMOTES LDL-C OXIDATION AND LIPID PEROXIDATION,INDUCES VASCULAR ENDOTHELIAL CELL DYSFUNCTION, AND THE OXYGEN FREE RADICALS THAT ARE CREATED CAUSE AN INFLAMMATORY REACTION OF THE VASCULAR WALL THAT PROMOTES ATHEROSCLEROSIS[11]; (II)THE LEVEL OF URIC ACID IN THE BLOOD RISES AND THE EXCESS TURNS INTO CRYSTALS, TRIGGERING SEVERE INFLAMMATION IN VASCULAR WALLS[12]. SOME RESEARCH SHOW THAT THERE IS A LARGE AMOUNT OF URIC ACID CRYSTALS IN ATHEROSCLEROTIC PLAQUES[13]. (III) THE INFLAMMATORY REACTION CAUSED BY URIC ACID CRYSTALS ACTIVATES PLATELET FUNCTION, WHICH INCREASES PLATELET ADHESION AND STARTS THE COAGULATION CASCADE, WHICH ULTIMATELY PROMOTES THROMBOSIS[14]; (IV)URIC ACID CAUSES ENDOTHELIAL DYSFUNCTION, PROMOTES THE FORMATION OF LOCAL OXIDIZING AGENTS AND THE REACTION OF INFLAMMATORY MEDIATORS SUCH AS MONOCYTE CHEMOATTRACTANT PROTEIN,NUCLEAR FACTOR-KB, INTERLEUKIN (IL)-1B,IL-6, AND TUMOUR NECROSIS FACTOR-A[15]; (V)ACTIVATION OF THE RENIN-ANGIOTENSIN SYSTEM RELATED TO UA MAY ATTACK CEREBRAL CIRCULATION[16].

IN OUR STUDY, UA WAS THE ONLY INDEPENDENT RISK FACTOR OF ICAS, NOT FOR ECAS.THE RESULTS PROVED THAT RISK FACTORS OF INTRACRANIAL AND EXTRACRANIAL ATHEROSCLEROSIS STENOSIS WERE DIFFERENT WHICH WAS CONSISTENT WITH LI[17].

PREVIOUS RESEARCH OFTEN COMBINED THE INTRACRANIAL AND EXTRACRANIAL ARTERIES TO INVESTIGATE THE RISKS. BUT LANLLNEI[18] FOUND THAT ATHEROSCLEROTIC PLAQUES WERE DIFFERENT BETWEEN INTRACRANIAL AND EXTRACRANIAL ARTERIES FROM AUTOPSIES OF PATIENTS WITH CEREBRAL INFARCTION. INZITARI[19] INSISTED THAT THE RISKS OF INTRACRANIAL AND EXTRACRANIAL ATHEROSCLEROSIS STENOSIS WERE DIFFERENT, THE SAME TREATMENT MIGHT HAVE DIFFERENT RESULTS. COMPARED WITH NORMAL PEOPLE,SOME CLINICAL RESEARCH INDICATED THAT THERE WERE LESS ANTIOXIDANTS WHICH HAD THE FUNCTION CURE ATHEROSCLEROSIS IN SOME DEGREE IN INTRACRANIAL ARTERIES OF PATIENTS WITH STENO-OCCLUSIVE INTRACRANIAL ARTERIES[20].SO ANTIOXIDANTS WAS AN INDEPENDENT PROTECTIVE FACTOR OF INTRACRANIAL STENOSIS.MOREOVER, MANY STUDIES FOUND THAT LOW WALL SHEAR STRESS AND HYPERLIPEMIA WERE MAIN RISK HEMODYNAMIC FACTORS IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF ATHEROSCLEROTIC PLAQUE IN EXTRACRANIAL ARTERIES[21] [22].

AS THE POPULATION WAS ALL HAN NATIONALITY, WE AVOIDED THE INFLUENCE OF ETHNIC VARIATION ON DISTRIBUTION OF STENOSIS OF INTRACRANIAL AND EXTRACRANIAL ARTERIES.THIS STUDY HAS SEVERAL LIMITATIONS: OUR DATA WERE OBTAINED IN A SINGLE CENTER, AND, ACCORDINGLY, AN EXTRAPOLATION OF OUR FINDINGS TO THE GENERAL CHINESE STROKE POPULATION OR OTHER ETHNIC POPULATIONS MIGHT BE LIMITED. WE COMPARED UA WITHIN ISCHEMIC STROKE POPULATION. IN THIS PRESENT STUDY, HYPERTENSION, AGE, DIABETES MELLITUS,LDL-C AND TC WERE NOT INDEPENDENT RISK FACTORS FOR INTRACRANIAL STENOSIS OR EXTRACRANIAL STENOSIS, THAT WERE NOT CONSISTENT WITH THE RESULTS OF PREVIOUS STUDIES [23]. THIS RESULT MIGHT HAVE BEEN CAUSED BY THE SMALL SAMPLE SIZE AND THE CROSS-SECTIONAL NATURE OF THE STUDY.SO A LARGER SAMPLE PROSPECTIVE MULTICENTER SURVEY WILL BE NEEDED IN HEALTHY POPULATION. AS WE CHOSE A RETROSPECTIVE STUDY, IT WAS UNAVOIDABLE TO BRING OUT THE SELECTION BIAS. BUT THE RELATIONSHIP OF UA AND STENOSIS OF INTRACRANIAL AND EXTRACRANIAL ARTERIES IS SIGNIFICANT FOR PREVENTION AND TREATMENT OF STROKE.

ItemContent.Para: ALL PROCEDURES PERFORMED IN STUDIES INVOLVING HUMAN PARTICIPANTS WERE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ETHICAL STANDARDS OF THE THE ETHICS COMMITTEES OF:SECOND AFFILIATED HOSPITAL OF FUJIAN MEDICAL UNIVERSITY,QUANZHOU, FUJIAN PROVINCE, CHINA,AND WITH THE 1964 HELSINKI DECLARATION AND ITS LATER AMENDMENTS OR COMPARABLE ETHICAL STANDARDS.
